author: Special Correspondent
text:
Students should develop reading habit and not be complacent: Arun Roy

Students presenting a cultural programme at TNAU - Agricultural College and Research Institute near Tiruchi on Thursday.— PHOTO: M. SRINATH

Simple and systematic preparation is needed to get through the civil service examinations, said V. Arun Roy, Registrar and Vice-Chancellor (in-charge) of Tamil Nadu National Law School here on Thursday.

Addressing students of Tamil Nadu Agricultural College Anbil Dharmalingam Agricultural College and Research Centre and the TNAU Horticultural College and Research Centre for Women at the valediction of intra-college cultural programme “Galatta 16” on the college campus, he explained the procedure for preparing for the civil service exams.

With the campus of the National Law School and the TNAU colleges located at a stone’s throw distance, he offered to guide students who aspired for the competitive exam.

Mr. Roy emphasised the need for student to develop the habit of reading newspapers and books, without being complacent with their academic records.

Reading habit was a key to personality development, he said.

M. Jawaharlal, Dean of TNAU Horticultural College and Research Institute for Women, and P. Pandiyarajan, Dean of TNAU Anbil Dharmalingam Agricultural College and Research Institute, offered felicitations. They said that 22 events were organised in which 200 students participated.

The overall shield went to the Third year students of the college.
title: Law School Registrar offers to guide civil service aspirants
